drug.name: Piclamilast
drug.description: Piclamilast (RP-73,401), is a selective PDE4 inhibitor comparable to other PDE4 inhibitors for its anti-inflammatory effects. It has been investigated for its applications to the treatment of conditions such as chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, bronchopulmonary dysplasia and asthma. The structure for piclamilast was first elucidated in a 1995 European patent application and exhibits the structural functionalities of cilomilast and roflumilast.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as benzamides. These are organic compounds containing a carboxamido substituent attached to a benzene ring.

drug-interaction.name: Riociguat
drug-interaction.description: Piclamilast may increase the hypotensive activities of Riociguat.

article.citation: Beeh KM, Beier J, Lerch C, Schulz AK, Buhl R: Effects of piclamilast, a selective phosphodiesterase-4 inhibitor, on oxidative burst of sputum cells from mild asthmatics and stable COPD patients. Lung. 2004;182(6):369-77.

polypeptide.name: cAMP-specific 3',5'-cyclic phosphodiesterase 4A
polypeptide.specific-function: Hydrolyzes the second messenger cAMP, which is a key regulator of many important physiological processes.

go-classifier.description: regulation of protein kinase A signaling

article.citation: Beeh KM, Beier J, Lerch C, Schulz AK, Buhl R: Effects of piclamilast, a selective phosphodiesterase-4 inhibitor, on oxidative burst of sputum cells from mild asthmatics and stable COPD patients. Lung. 2004;182(6):369-77.
Berman HM, Westbrook J, Feng Z, Gilliland G, Bhat TN, Weissig H, Shindyalov IN, Bourne PE: The Protein Data Bank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2000 Jan 1;28(1):235-42.

polypeptide.name: cAMP-specific 3',5'-cyclic phosphodiesterase 4B
polypeptide.specific-function: Hydrolyzes the second messenger cAMP, which is a key regulator of many important physiological processes. May be involved in mediating central nervous system effects of therapeutic agents ranging from antidepressants to antiasthmatic and anti-inflammatory agents.

go-classifier.description: negative regulation of relaxation of cardiac muscle
regulation of cardiac muscle cell contraction
regulation of high voltage-gated calcium channel activity
